Titulo: BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ-NiO Composite Anodic Powders for Proton-Conducting SOFCs Prepared by a Combustion Method

Sentencas: (BZY)-NiO composite powders with different BZY-NiO weight ratios were prepared by a combustion method as anodes for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ-NiO Composite Anodic Powders for Proton-Conducting SOFCs Prepared by a Combustion Method

Sentencas: After heating to 1100 degrees C for 6 h, the composite powders were made of a well-dispersed mixture of two phases, BZY and NiO. Chemical stability tests showed that the BZY-NiO anodic powders had good stability against CO2, whereas comparative tests under the same conditions showed degradation for BaCe0.7Zr0.1Y0.2O3-delta NiO, which is at present the most used anode material for proton-conducting SOFCs.
Titulo: BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ-NiO Composite Anodic Powders for Proton-Conducting SOFCs Prepared by a Combustion Method

Sentencas: Area specific resistance (ASR) measurements for BZY-NiO anodes showed that their electrochemical performance depended on the BZY-NiO weight ratio.
Titulo: BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ-NiO Composite Anodic Powders for Proton-Conducting SOFCs Prepared by a Combustion Method

Sentencas: The best performance was obtained for the anode containing 50 wt % BZY and 50 wt % NiO, which showed the smallest ASR values in the whole testing temperature range (0.37 Omega cm(2) at 600 degrees C).
Titulo: BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ-NiO Composite Anodic Powders for Proton-Conducting SOFCs Prepared by a Combustion Method

Sentencas: The 50 wt % BZY and 50 wt % NiO anode prepared by combustion also showed superior performance than that of the BZY-NiO anode conventionally made by a mechanical mixing route, as well as that of Pt. (C) 2011 The Electrochemical Society.
Titulo: BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-δ-NiO Composite Anodic Powders for Proton-Conducting SOFCs Prepared by a Combustion Method
